org.apache.flink.spargel.java

Class VertexUpdateFunction<VertexKey extends Comparable<VertexKey>,VertexValue,Message>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flink.spargel.java.VertexUpdateFunction<VertexKey,VertexValue,Message>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SpargelConnectedComponents.CCUpdater, SpargelPageRank.VertexRankUpdater, SpargelPageRankCountingVertices.VertexRankUpdater

    public abstract class VertexUpdateFunction<VertexKey extends Comparable<VertexKey>,VertexValue,Message>
extends Object
implements Serializable
    This class must be extended by functions that compute the state of the vertex depending on the old state and the incoming messages. The central method is updateVertex(Comparable, Object, MessageIterator), which is invoked once per vertex per superstep. The vertex key type. The vertex value type. The message type.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • VertexUpdateFunction

        public VertexUpdateFunction()

    • Method Detail

      • updateVertex

        public abstract void updateVertex(VertexKey vertexKey,
                                  VertexValue vertexValue,
                                  MessageIterator<Message> inMessages)
                           throws Exception
        This method is invoked once per vertex per superstep. It receives the current state of the vertex, as well as the incoming messages. It may set a new vertex state via setNewVertexValue(Object). If the vertex state is changed, it will trigger the sending of messages via the MessagingFunction.
        Parameters:
        vertexKey - The key (identifier) of the vertex.
        vertexValue - The value (state) of the vertex.
        inMessages - The incoming messages to this vertex.
        Throws:
        Exception - The computation may throw exceptions, which causes the superstep to fail.

      • preSuperstep

        public void preSuperstep()
                  throws Exception
        This method is executed one per superstep before the vertex update function is invoked for each vertex.
        Throws:
        Exception - Exceptions in the pre-superstep phase cause the superstep to fail.

      • postSuperstep

        public void postSuperstep()
                   throws Exception
        This method is executed one per superstep after the vertex update function has been invoked for each vertex.
        Throws:
        Exception - Exceptions in the post-superstep phase cause the superstep to fail.

      • setNewVertexValue

        public void setNewVertexValue(VertexValue newValue)
        Sets the new value of this vertex. Setting a new value triggers the sending of outgoing messages from this vertex.
        Parameters:
        newValue - The new vertex value.

      • getSuperstepNumber

        public int getSuperstepNumber()
        Gets the number of the superstep, starting at 1.
        Returns:
        The number of the current superstep.

      • getIterationAggregator

        public <T extends Aggregator<?>> T getIterationAggregator(String name)
        Gets the iteration aggregator registered under the given name. The iteration aggregator is combines all aggregates globally once per superstep and makes them available in the next superstep.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the aggregator.
        Returns:
        The aggregator registered under this name, or null, if no aggregator was registered.

      • getPreviousIterationAggregate

        public <T extends Value> T getPreviousIterationAggregate(String name)
        Get the aggregated value that an aggregator computed in the previous iteration.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the aggregator.
        Returns:
        The aggregated value of the previous iteration.

      • getBroadcastSet

        public <T> Collection<T> getBroadcastSet(String name)
        Gets the broadcast data set registered under the given name. Broadcast data sets are available on all parallel instances of a function. They can be registered via VertexCentricIteration.addBroadcastSetForUpdateFunction(String, org.apache.flink.api.java.DataSet).
        Parameters:
        name - The name under which the broadcast set is registered.
        Returns:
        The broadcast data set.
